greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider the Farey tree A006842/A006843; a(n) = row at which the denominator n first appears (assumes first row is labeled row 1).
comment: Richard C. Schroeppel also asked about the analogous sequence giving the last occurrence of denominator n.
reference: Based on a posting by Richard C. Schroeppel to the Math Fun Mailing List, Dec 15 2010.
link: Bo Gyu Jeong, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Richard J. Mathar, The Kepler binary tree of reduced fractions, 2017.
xref: See A178047 for another version. Cf. A006842, A006843, A177903, A178042.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 16 2010
ext: More terms from _Bo Gyu Jeong_, Oct 20 2012
